Can aqua regia dissolve gold? Aqua regia gold dissolution
Although gold is typically an inert metal, it will dissolve in aqua regia because of the unique action of nitric and hydrochloric acid.
Can aqua regia dissolve gold? Aqua regia gold dissolution

Dissolving Gold Aqua regia is used to dissolve gold. Neither nitric acid or hydrochloric acid can do this alone. Nitric acid will act as the oxidizer and is used to form gold ions (Au3+). The hydrochloric acid is then used to react with the gold ions to form tetrachloroaurate(III) anions.
